properties.name: chatgpt.api-key
properties.description: apiKey of chatgpt. It can be generated in this link https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys

properties.name: chatgpt.model
properties.description: ID of the model to use. You can see our Model overview (https://platform.openai.com/docs/models/overview) for descriptions of them.

properties.name: chatgpt.max-tokens
properties.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.The token count of your prompt plus max_tokens cannot exceed the model's context length. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 4096).

properties.name: chatgpt.temperature
properties.description: What sampling temperature to use. Higher values means the model will take more risks. Try 0.9 for more creative applications, and 0 (argmax sampling) for ones with a well-defined answer.We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

properties.name: chatgpt.top-p
properties.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

properties.name: chatgpt.multi.model
properties.description: ID of the model to use. See the model endpoint compatibility (https://platform.openai.com/docs/models/model-endpoint-compatibility) table for details on which models work with the Chat API.

properties.name: chatgpt.multi.max-tokens
properties.description:
The maximum number of tokens to generate in the chat completion.

The total length of input tokens and generated tokens is limited by the model's context length.

properties.name: chatgpt.multi.temperature
properties.description: What sampling temperature to use. Higher values means the model will take more risks. Try 0.9 for more creative applications, and 0 (argmax sampling) for ones with a well-defined answer.We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

properties.name: chatgpt.multi.top-p
properties.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.
